titleStmt.title: J. C. Conkin to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9797

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: The Commonwealth of Kentucky Monroe County Sct

Be it remembered that at a county court Began & held for said county at the court house in the Town of Tompkinsville on the 26th day of Decr 1859 C E Barry Judge presiding &c the following proceedings were had to wit

On motion of Milton Berry and E W Huggins -- It is ordered by the court that a licence be granted to them to Keep a tavern in the town of Tompkinsville for twelve months from this date -- It was also proven in open Court that it was necessary to have a tavern Kept in said town of Tompkinsville & that said Berry and Huggins were prepared to Keep a Tavern as the law required who came into open court and executed the covenant required of them by law together with John Black, W D Martin and John H McMillon as their security Conditioned as the law directs

A copy Test
J, C, Conkin C M C
By J, H, Conkin D C
